Class SingleQueue<T>

java.lang.Object
cp213.SingleLink<T>
cp213.SingleQueue<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the SingleNode data type
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<T>
public class SingleQueue<T> extends SingleLink<T>
A single linked queue structure of T objects. Only the front T object contained in the queue is visible through the standard queue methods. Extends the SingleLink class.
Version:
2025-09-07
Author:
your name, id, email here

  • Constructor Details

    • SingleQueue

      public SingleQueue()

  • Method Details

    • combine

      public void combine(SingleQueue<T> left, SingleQueue<T> right)
      Combines the contents of left and right into this. Moves nodes only - does not refer to data in any way, or call the high-level methods insert or remove. left and right are empty when done. Nodes are moved alternately from left and right into the rear of this. this may be empty. May call any appropriate SingleLink helper methods available. left and right are not necessarily the same length.
      Parameters:
      left - the first SingleQueue to extract nodes from
      right - the second SingleQueue to extract nodes from

    • insert

      public void insert(T datum)
      Adds data to the rear of this. Increments the queue length.
      Parameters:
      datum - the data to add to the rear of the queue

    • remove

      public T remove()
      Returns and removes the front data of this. The next node in the queue becomes the new front node. Decrements the queue length.
      Returns:
      the object at the front of the queue or null if this is empty

    • splitAlternate

      public void splitAlternate(SingleQueue<T> left, SingleQueue<T> right)
      Splits the contents of this into left and right. Moves nodes only - does not move data or call the high-level methods insert or remove. this is empty when done. Nodes are moved alternately from this to the rear of left and right. left and right may already contain data.

      This is the opposite of the combine method.

      Parameters:
      left - the first SingleQueue to move nodes to
      right - the second SingleQueue to move nodes to
